commText: Kohli and du Plessis are at the crease. Kohli is on strike. Mohit Sharma will open the attack

Mohit Sharma to Kohli, no run, 137.1kph, full outswinger, push-driven to the right of extra cover and Kohli sets off. Miller makes a superb diving stop and has a shy at the stumps at the keeper's end. Kohli lost his bat and was nowhere in the scene. Luckily for him, there was no direct hit
Mohit Sharma to Kohli, SIX, Kohli gets off the mark with a stylish 88m six! Pitched up ball and Kohli hits through the line. Lofts it handsomely over long-off and poses for the photographs. I0$
Mohit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, 136kph, full delivery, knocked down the pitch for a single
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, no run, 137.4kph, fuller than a length, du Plessis is early into his push/drive, gets an inside edge that dies down adjacent to the pitch
Disturbance near the sight-screen and du Plessis moves away...
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, to cover, 129.2kph, fuller than a good length, driven to the right of cover point for a quick single

Mohit Sharma to Kohli, SIX, 132kph, second six of the over for Kohli. Shimmies down the track against the pacer and brings those I0$ into play as he whips this length ball over deep midwicket. Generates a lot of power!
Joshua Little, comes into the attack

Joshua Little to du Plessis, FOUR, 139kph, du Plessis greets Joshua Little with a boundary. Shortish ball around leg and du Plessis wristily pulls it away to the long leg fence. The man in the deep was too square

Joshua Little to du Plessis, FOUR, just over the fielder! 135.5kph, du Plessis drives, doesn't bother to keep it down but hits him high on the bat. Gill is a few inches in front of the 30-yard circle at mid-off and even a jump from him isn't sufficient
Joshua Little to du Plessis, SIX, middles this one! Touch fuller from Little and the RCB captain lofts it beautifully straight down the ground. RCB off to a flier!
Joshua Little to du Plessis, 2 runs, 139.4kph, full and wide of off, du Plessis opens the bat-face to slice it over the covers. Noor runs back and stops the ball from hitting the fence
Joshua Little to du Plessis, no run, 127.4kph, du Plessis clips to square leg off the inner part of the bat

Joshua Little to du Plessis, FOUR, one bounce and into the fence! Harmless short ball, du Plessis pulls fiercely over midwicket for a one-bounce four. First over this season and Joshua Little has conceded 20 runs!
One slip in place
Manav Suthar, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Manav Suthar to Kohli, 1 run, 93.8kph, flat and full around off, driven firmly to long-off
Manav Suthar to du Plessis, no run, 89.4kph, more air on this in-drifter, du Plessis watchfully knocks it back to the bowler

Manav Suthar to du Plessis, SIX, 91.5kph, du Plessis backs away even before the ball is delivered. The bowler follows him but bowls in the slot. Faf du Plessis gets under it and smokes it downtown for a biggie
Manav Suthar to du Plessis, FOUR, 89.6kph, Manav Suthar pulls his length back, du Plessis backs away to scythe it through the covers. In the gap and the ball races away
Manav Suthar to du Plessis, 1 run, 87.5kph, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
Manav Suthar to Kohli, no run, 87.6kph, hint of spin from a length, Kohli cuts off the back foot and Gill makes a sharp stop to his right at extra cover. 12 runs off the over!
The asking rate is just 6 RPO now! Change of ends for Mohit and the keeper is now standing up to the sticks
Mohit Sharma [1.0-0-14-0] is back into the attack
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, 133.1kph, length ball, du Plessis clears his front leg to heave it over midwicket. A couple of bounces and into the fence. Fifty up for RCB in 19 balls!
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, slower and shorter, du Plessis spots it and pats it towards mid-off
Deep midwicket and deep square leg in place for Kohli
Mohit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, Mohit Sharma follows a backing away batsman with a length ball and that's been turned to midwicket
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, 113.5kph, pace off, Mohit serves width outside off. Faf du Plessis clears his front leg and slaps the cut between cover and mid-off. Reaches the fence in a jiffy
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, 106.5kph, pace off, full and in the slot, du Plessis thumps it downtown and the ball hits the boundary rope on the half-volley!

Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, this is incredible batting! Nothing wrong with the ball from Mohit Sharma. It's on a length and around off, du Plessis waits a bit and flays the cut through backward point. 18 runs off the over!
Manav Suthar to Kohli, no run, pushed back to the bowler
Manav Suthar to Kohli, no run, nudged into the leg-side
Manav Suthar to Kohli, SIX, wow! 93.5kph, flat ball, Kohli moves leg-side, gets down on one leg and wristily swipes it over long-on
Manav Suthar to Kohli, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Kohli! Manav shortens his length and the Orange Cap holder is quick to rock back and pummel it over cow corner
Manav Suthar to Kohli, 1 run, looks to slogsweep and inside-edges to deep midwicket
Manav Suthar to du Plessis, 1 run, 93.2kph, driven along the ground to long-off and it's an 18-ball half-century for du Plessis! The RCB captain gets a hug from Kohli
Joshua Little [1.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack
Joshua Little to du Plessis, FOUR, the boundaries keep coming! 135.6kph, harmless shortish ball and du Plessis moves leg-side to heave it over midwicket
Joshua Little to du Plessis, no run, 136.8kph, wide yorker, du Plessis reaches out to try and squeeze it towards third man. Loses his balance in the process and fails to connect

Fastest fifty for RCB (by ball faced) 17 - Chris Gayle vs PWI, Bengaluru, 2013 18 - Faf du Plessis vs GT, Bengaluru, today* 19 - Robin Uthappa vs PBKS, Bengaluru, 2010 19 - Rajat Patidar vs SRH, Hyderabad, 2024
Joshua Little to du Plessis, SIX, 142.7kph, full delivery in the slot outside off and du Plessis smokes it over long-off for an 85m hit

Joshua Little to du Plessis, FOUR, 143.1kph, width on offer. Faf du Plessis takes his front leg out of the equation and slaps the cut through extra cover. Once again, the placement is spot-on from the skipper
Joshua Little to du Plessis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Joshua Little to du Plessis, out Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! Something to cheer for GT but it's come too late for GT! 139.6kph, short ball that cramps the batsman for room. Faf du Plessis hurriedly pulls and top-edges towards short fine where Shahrukh doesn't err. End of an excellent knock from the RCB captain. du Plessis c Shahrukh Khan b Joshua Little 64(23) [4s-10 6s-3]
Will Jacks, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Joshua Little to Will Jacks, no run, 135kph, fuller than a good length, push-driven to cover
Strategic timeout!
Summary (Overs 1-6) > RCB off to a flying start > Faf gets to an 18-ball 50 > Little finally removes Faf for 64 off 23 > Best powerplay ever for RCB - 92/1
Highest powerplay scores in the IPL 125/0 - SRH vs DC, 2024 105/0 - KKR vs RCB, 2017 100/2 - CSK vs PBKS, 2014 93/1 - PBKS vs KKR, 2024 92/2 - DC vs MI, 2024 92/1 - RCB vs GT, today*
Noor Ahmad, comes into the attack

Noor Ahmad to Kohli, FOUR, imperious timing and placement! Flatter delivery pushed out wide outside off, Kohli pressed back and across before slashing it hard, struck it well in front of point and the man at deep point couldn't get around
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery outside off, slapped down the ground to long-off

Noor Ahmad to Will Jacks, 1 run, in the air and safe! Length delivery on off-stump, Will Jacks wasn't sure which way this was turning, closed the face too early and it turned away to catch the leading edge, just lobbed over and away to Gill's left at extra cover
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, 1 run, full outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off
Noor Ahmad to Will Jacks, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Noor Ahmad to Will Jacks, out Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! In the air again and he's gone this time! The leading edge once more, a wrong-un on middle, Will Jacks did not pick it and closed the face too early looking to work it into the leg-side. It took the leading edge and lobbed up high before going down to the man at long-on. Easy catch and Shahrukh made no mistake. Jacks goes without many tonight. Will Jacks c Shahrukh Khan b Noor Ahmad 1(3)
Rajat Patidar, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Noor Ahmad to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, tossed up full on off-stump from round the wicket, worked away to deep mid-wicket
Joshua Little to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, length delivery slanting across outside off, Rajat Patidar waits for it and cuts it away to deep backward point
Joshua Little to Kohli, 1 run, crunched straight to the man, length delivery outside off, width on offer and Kohli slapped it hard, one bounce and straight to the man at sweeper cover
Joshua Little to Rajat Patidar, wide, banged in short, too short as it goes over his head
Most runs by a RCB batter within powerplay 64 - Faf du plessis vs GT, 2024* 50 - Chris Gayle vs PWI, 2012 50 - Chris Gayle vs PWI, 2013 50 - Chris Gayle vs PBKS, 2015
Joshua Little to Rajat Patidar, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Joshua Little to Rajat Patidar, out Caught by Miller!! Straight to the fielder once more! RCB losing a few wickets in a hurry here. Banged in short on middle, Rajat Patidar seemed to hit this nicely as he pulled it but he didn't get much elevation on it. HIt it flat and picked the man out at deep mid-wicket. Patidar falls cheaply as well. Rajat Patidar c Miller b Joshua Little 2(3)
Glenn Maxwell, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Joshua Little to Maxwell, FOUR, Maxwell off and running with a boundary! Very full on middle, Maxwell had cleared his front-leg early and he whipped it through to the mid-wicket ropes
Joshua Little to Maxwell, no run, back of a length on middle, Maxwell looks to make a bit of room and slash it away before missing
Joshua Little to Maxwell, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Joshua Little to Maxwell, out Caught by Miller!! And another one bites the dust! RCB throwing wickets away here in their quest to get this done quickly. Length delivery on middle, Maxwell pressed back before heaving it away towards deep square leg, hit it fairly well but not well enough as he picked Miller out. RCB might need to pull back on the pedal a little bit here after this. Maxwell c Miller b Joshua Little 4(3) [4s-1]
Cameron Green, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, no run, length delivery on middle, Kohli presses back and blocks
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, no run, length delivery just outside off, punched towards extra cover
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, no run, full on off-stump, Kohli leans in and knocks it towards cover, he wanted the single but Green didn't
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, no run, length delivery on off-stump, knocked back towards the bowler
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, no run, full and just outside off, given some air and it went on with the arm, Kohli looked to drive and was beaten
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery on leg-stump, worked away to deep square leg, just a single off that over!
Joshua Little to Kohli, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off, Kohli hangs back and eases it down to third man
Joshua Little to Green, 1 run, length delivery outside off, punched out towards sweeper cover
Joshua Little to Kohli, no run, back of a length and outside off, Kohli looks to tap it down into the off-side and misses
Joshua Little to Kohli, 1 run, short of length and just outside off, Kohli arches back and steers it towards backward point for a quick single
Joshua Little to Green, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Joshua Little to Green, out Caught by Shahrukh Khan!! They're falling like ninepins here! Length delivery outside off, Green hung back and slashed at it, got a thick outside edge and it flew down to third man. Another simple catch for Shahrukh and Joshua Little has picked up 4 out of nowhere! Can we say that RCB are in a bit of strife? Not quite yet maybe. Green c Shahrukh Khan b Joshua Little 1(2)
Glenn Maxwell scores in IPL 2024 0(1) vs CSK 3(5) vs PBKS 28(19) vs KKR 0(2) vs LSG 1(3) vs RR 0(4) vs MI 4(3) vs GT* - He scored 36 runs at 5.14 average
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Joshua Little to Karthik, 1 run, banged in short on middle, Karthik pulls it uppishly towards deep square leg, wasn't in full control of that and it fell short of the man running in
Noor Ahmad to Karthik, no run, full just outside off, Karthik shuffles right across his stumps and sweeps it towards fine-leg off the gloves
Noor Ahmad to Karthik, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, pushed out towards cover for one
Cameron Green vs Pace in IPL 2024 Inns: 8 Ball: 47 Runs: 62 Dismissals: 5 Avg: 12.4 SR: 131.9
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, FOUR, a boundary to settle some nerves for RCB! Dragged down short outside off, a proper half-tracker and Kohli smacked it away hard through to the deep mid-wicket ropes
Noor Ahmad to Kohli, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Noor Ahmad to Kohli, out Caught by Saha!! Here's another wicket and the crowd has gone silent! Hard to believe what's happened in the last 20 minutes or so in this innings, it's completely turned on its head! Floated up full and just outside off, Kohli leaned in and opened the face of the bat looking to play it into the covers, it spun away and took a faint outside edge that was pouched safely by Saha! Kohli c Saha b Noor Ahmad 42(27) [4s-2 6s-4]
Swapnil Singh, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, no run, length delivery on off-stump, turns in on off-stump, Swapnil Singh looks to block and is hit on the top of the front pad
Josh Little's bowling today \nFirst over: 20 runs \nNext 3 overs:: 4/25
Lot of pressure on RCB suddenly, a slip and a forward short leg in for the new man
Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, no run, length delivery just outside off, Swapnil Singh presses back and chops it towards backward point
GT on attack now. A forward short leg stays along with slip
Rashid Khan, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, the crowd find their voice again! Tossed up full on off-stump, was the wrong-un, Karthik stepped out and whipped it over mid-wicket, no risk involved there as it was right in the gap
The forward short leg moves to leg-gully
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 2 runs, length delivery on off-stump, Karthik leans in and plays a reverse-sweep, gets it down to deep backward point for a couple more
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, half-tracker and put away! Dragged down short by Rashid Khan, Karthik was so quick to press back before hammering it to the deep square leg ropes with a pull

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, and another boundary! Flatter delivery just outside off, was the wrong-un, Karthik pressed back and made a bit of room before slapping it through the covers for another boundary, he's looking to kill this game right here and now
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, length delivery on middle, Karthik presses back and eases it towards cover
Virat Kohli's Innings today \nIn PP - 28(12), SR: 233.3 \nAfter PP - 14(15), SR: 93.33
Rashid Khan to Swapnil Singh, 1 run, full and outside off, Swapnil Singh leans forward and pushes it down the ground to long-on, 16 runs off the over and that is exactly what RCB needed

Summary (Overs 7-12) - 41 runs | 5 wickets: > Noor Ahmad removes Jacks in his 1st over > Little nips out Patidar & Maxwell in the same over > Noor concedes just 1 run off his 2nd over vs Kohli > Green falls to Little and the left-armer finishes with 4/45 > Kohli nicks off against Noor's wrong 'un > Rashid leaks 16 runs, courtesy DK's three fours
Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, no run, length delivery just outside off, turns back in quite sharply as Swapnil Singh presses back and across, gets a thick inside edge onto the pads
Karthik vs Rashid in IPL (before today) Balls: 31 Runs: 29 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 10.3 SR: 107.0
Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, leg byes, 1 run, full and on the pads, Swapnil Singh looks to work it into the leg-side and it lobs up off his pad, they sneak a leg-bye in
Noor Ahmad to Karthik, no run, full on middle, Karthik leans right in and defends
Noor Ahmad to Karthik, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, Karthik leans in and pushes it towards point for a quick single
Short leg back in place now

Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, FOUR, that's some shot under pressure! Floated up full on off-stump, Swapnil Singh shuffled across just a touch and leaned right in to play a lovely sweep shot, got it up and it went one-bounce to the deep backward square leg ropes

Noor Ahmad to Swapnil Singh, FOUR, and another boundary! You have to listen to the crowd now! Full on the pads from over the wicket this time, Swapnil Singh got a good stride in again before sweeping it crisply down to the deep backward square leg ropes
Just 5 needed now, surely no more antics
GT review. Seems to be in hope and nothing else, this was a shout for lbw that was turned down. Struck him well outside the line
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 2 runs, review lost! Floated up full on off-stump, Karthik leaned in and reverse-swept it past the man at short third man, was right off the gloves so the review is lost
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, length delivery on middle, Karthik leans in and sweeps it down to deep square leg
Just 2 needed now
Rashid Khan to Swapnil Singh, no run, flatter delivery just outside off, Swapnil Singh presses back and punches it straight to point
Rashid Khan to Swapnil Singh, SIX, that'll do very nicely for RCB! A full-toss tossed up on middle, Swapnil Singh made a bit of room and smoked it straight back over the bowler's head for a maximum!

22:46 Local Time, 17:16 GMT, 22:46 IST: A big win for RCB but that was anything but convincing! After getting 92/1 in the powerplay while chasing a meagre 148, there shouldn't even have been a question of the opposition having even a sniff and yet, it seemed like for a brief moment, GT were on top of the contest! It looked like the game was nearly done when RCB got their best ever powerplay score but they suffered a spectacular implosion to go from 92/0 to 117/6 in the space of 5 overs. There were some terrible shots played and there was an air of panic amongst all the supporters at the Chinnaswamy. But as it has been on numerous occasions for RCB, their man for all crises - Dinesh Karthik - ensured that they suffered no further hiccups before getting over the line in the 14th over. Josh Little finished with 4 wickets while Faf was the top scorer for RCB with 64 off 23. Stick around for the presentations.
RCB batting today \nFirst 6 overs: 92/1 \nNext 6 overs: 41/5
-> The chasing side has won all five matches between these two teams.
All stats for tonight by Shashikant Singh

Shubman Gill: It all depends on the wicket, you see the first couple of overs. You get an idea and you play according to that. I think 170-180 on this wicket would have been a good total. I think how we batted in the powerplay and how we bowled in the powerplay, that made a difference. We would have an extra bowling option (had we not lost early wickets.) Never easy. It's important for us to start from zero (in the next game), need to move on. Many positives to take from this game, need to make sure we don't repeat our mistakes. It's all about winning everything we can from here on.

Dinesh Karthik: Started with a cup of tea and then after about 4 overs, I had my first cappuccino. I thought I wasn't going to bat. I wasn't padded up, I wasn't mentally ready, I was just chilling. And then, things happened and then I had to pad up. I was a touch late but I just managed to make it. It's a very different sort of pressure, it's one thing chasing down totals in an interesting way and all you need to think about is hitting boundaries. But if there's a lot of time and you need to make sure that playing sensibly is also the need of the hour, then your basic cricketing skills come through, how you are able to hit boundaries without taking risks. Over a period of time, that's been my strengths, so I backed myself to that. The pitch was initially good to bowl on. Being under the covers for so long, there was a bit of moisture. It was sticky, tough to start on, good toss to win and we bowled very well. Got to give credit to the bowlers. No matter what the pitch is, to keep the score under the score we kept at the end of six overs is quite a task and I thought they bowled beautifully today. The way Faf and Virat batted, I don't think you could have played the some kind of shots if you were batting first. Also, the skill that both of them have, I enjoyed how they went about things. (Chat with Swapnil while facing Noor) I told Swapnil to play for the ball that comes in so that the one that goes away remains a dot ball. It looks good but doesn't get the wicket. He asked me if sweep was a good option and I said, "If you feel sweep is a good option, back yourself to do it but commit to the shot, don't be half-hearted." Then he executed those two sweep shots which were very good and that was the need of the hour in a way.

Faf du Plessis | RCB Captain: We've been really good in the last few games, with both bat and ball. We've been unbelievable in the field as well. The wicket was a bit different, there was a bit more bounce. Wanted to make sure we take that information from the pitch and give it to the bowlers. Yes there was a dropped catch but it's the effort that we look for and that was there throughout. The games we've played here have all been high-scoring, anything around 180-190 would've been par. Was important we didn't look at the scoreboard when we went out to bat and try and play the way we play. Was a bit nervous. Probably not the best assessment from us there. Yes we wanted to go out there and get the total quickly to boost the NRR but probably when we were 4 down, we had to calm down a little bit.

Mohammed Siraj | Player of the Match: I was really ill for the last few days, thought I might not be able to play today but I really wanted to play so it was great that I was able to. Got the success today after practising a lot with the new ball this year. Reminded me of last year. When I woke up in the morning, I thought I wouldn't be able to play and that I should take rest. When I woke up, I manifested what I wanted to do and that's exactly what happened. Not easy to switch between red and white ball cricket. You need to give your 110% every ball here.

Big win for RCB in the context of the tournament. They keep their playoffs hopes alive although it is fairly slim. That win also takes them off the bottom of the table and up to number 7. That'll boost their confidence because it felt like they'd been rooted to the bottom for an eternity. On the flip side, this loss will sting for GT. Twice in two games now that they've been trumped by RCB and their own playoffs hopes now hang by a slim thread. Three games left for both teams and RCB have done their NRR wonders with today's win and that's something that could come into play as we head into the back end of the tournament. Right, that's it from us for tonight. This is Anurag Hegde signing off on behalf of Nikhil JD, Abhinand Raghavendran and Siva. Take care and goodbye.
